alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 12:02AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1201 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Fredonia to 11 miles northwest of Jamestown to 15 miles east of Erie. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Russell, Spring Creek, Lottsville, Sugar Grove and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
